name: iOS 15 UI Components
description:
iOS 15 UI Components (v2.5)

Figma components based on Human Interface Guidelines


The Flexible Library System which contains components formed based on the documentation from Apple (HIG) for creating iOS user interfaces.


The library supports the following features: 

  • Dark & Light Theme
  • Variants
  • Flexible Components
  • Global Styles
  • Auto Layouts
  • Interaction Components


FAQ

How do I use this library? 

  1. Copy the project from community to your profile in Figma
  2. Go to the copied project
  3. In the left toolbar, find the "assets" section and click on it.
  4. After that, click on the "book" icon next To the library name (iOS UI Kit-Native styles), click on the "Publish" button. Done!


How do I use this library? (Free Figma Account) 

  1. Copy the project from community to your profile in Figma
  2. Go to the copied project
  3. Copy the component you need and transfer it to the project.
  4. All the atoms of the component and its variations will be transferred automatically, you can configure or edit the component locally in your project. Done!


I work on the Windows operating system

Who works on Windows, icons may not be displayed correctly for you. I have created a vector version of icons specially for you, which you can change in the components. You can download all native icons for iOS in vector format here. SF Symbols 3


How to work with Auto Layouts 

You will notice that the component contains all possible atoms. Hide the atoms you don't need and the auto layout system will adjust your component to the desired state. You can also customize the components by adding your own atoms, the auto layout system will also help you with this.
